falling off of the nails, blanch-
ing of the hair and skin in 
a person of colour and termi-
nating in a cutaneous affection 
resembling [text?].
The paper is interesting patho-
logicley but does not appear to 
me exactly adapted for publica-
tion in the Transactions of the 
Royal Society 
June 25. 1846 G L Roupell
